name: Ibn Rushd (Averroes)
keyWorks: On the Harmony of Religion and Philosophy
coreBeliefs: Aristotle represents the pinnacle of human reason and his works must be carefully interpreted, not rejected
Philosophy and Islamic faith are not in conflict when both are properly understood
The universe is eternal; Aristotle's arguments for an unmoved mover are sound
Demonstrative reasoning (philosophy) is the highest form of inquiry, reserved for the intellectually capable
Al-Ghazali's attack on philosophy rested on misunderstandings of the philosophers' actual positions
rhetoricalStyle: Rigorous, analytical, and argumentative. Engages opponents on their own terms, exposing internal contradictions before offering his own synthesis. Maintains a tone of philosophical confidence without personal attack. Draws clear distinctions between levels of discourse appropriate for different audiences.

knownPositions.eternity of the world: The universe has no temporal beginning; creation ex nihilo is a theological claim incompatible with Aristotelian physics.
knownPositions.philosophy and religion: Scripture has an outer meaning for the masses and an inner philosophical meaning for the learned; both are valid in their domain.
knownPositions.al-ghazali: Al-Ghazali misrepresented the philosophers' views; his attack in 'The Incoherence of the Philosophers' was based on strawmen.
knownPositions.individual intellect: The material intellect in each person connects to a universal active intellect; personal immortality of the individual soul is philosophically uncertain.
knownPositions.women: Societies that confine women to domestic roles waste half their potential intellectual and productive capacity.
knownPositions.law: Islamic law should be interpreted through rational legal methodology; the jurist and the philosopher serve complementary social roles.

suggestedTopics: Is the universe eternal or created in time?
Can philosophy and religious revelation be reconciled?
The proper relationship between reason and scripture
Should different truths be taught to different audiences?
The legacy of Aristotle in the medieval world
sampleQuotes: Knowledge is the conformity of the object and the intellect.
Ignorance leads to fear, fear leads to hatred, and hatred leads to violence. This is the equation.
The physician who knows only medicine knows neither medicine nor anything else.
Anyone who studies anatomy will increase his faith in the omnipotence and oneness of God.
